poem.title: Apollo Belvedere
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: There's scarce enough to keep her vest and breeks up But he's watching her not me. She looks this way. He sees Her gym shoes worn like clogs, to keep the heels free In the heat (she should try being marble). An empty brow, three traits for eyes and mouth - no, wait: Two dots that slide behind the lids, like drops on a rail â€“ she does have eyes. Two commas - that would be her flaring nostrils. Canons change, Popes also, even gallery attendants. There, He'll rip the sketch out, lob it at the bin And she'll move on.
